title: Roadmap: harden dotfiles safety, flexibility, and reliability
description:
Background
Current stack (tuckr + gmake) is strong for happy-path personal setup but lacks robust guarantees for host variance, rollback, and drift resilience.

Objective
Deliver a prioritized roadmap that closes critical operational risks first (P0), then flexibility and quality upgrades (P1), and finally advanced ergonomics/governance (P2).

Priorities
P0: safety guardrails, rollback, CI gates, secrets hardening
P1: host overlays, deeper test coverage, drift and perf budgets
P2: richer team ergonomics, auditability, and advanced automation

Scope
- Makefile/make/*.mk orchestration and safety improvements
- tests/ + CI reliability gates
- Secrets lifecycle hardening
- Multi-machine flexibility and role-aware behavior

Out of scope
- Rewriting to a different manager (e.g., full migration to chezmoi/home-manager) in this milestone
acceptance_criteria:
1) Child tasks exist with priorities and dependencies
2) Each task has concrete acceptance criteria and implementation scope
3) Roadmap can be executed incrementally without breaking current workflows
4) Critical risks around destructive operations and lack of rollback are addressed first

title: Add preflight safety gate, dry-run, and deploy verification
description:
Implement hard safety gates before and after deployment operations.

Scope
- Add `gmake dotfiles-preflight` to detect conflict files in $HOME, missing deps, permission risks, and invalid repo state.
- Add `gmake dotfiles-dryrun` wrapping `tuckr -n set *` (safe preview).
- Add `gmake dotfiles-verify` using `tuckr status --json` and failing on conflicts/not_symlinked entries.
- Integrate these targets into normal deployment flow and CI checks.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Preflight fails with actionable messages when conflicts or missing prerequisites exist
2) Dry-run performs no filesystem writes
3) Verify target exits non-zero on any deployment conflict or missing symlink
4) Deployment docs include the preflight -> dry-run -> apply -> verify flow

title: Add toolchain conflict detection and version policy
description:
Reduce runtime manager and package conflict ambiguity.

Scope
- Define policy for overlapping managers (asdf/nvm, ruby/gem variants, etc.).
- Add verification target to detect conflicting binaries/versions on PATH.
- Align package declarations with policy to avoid accidental dual-management.
- Document supported versions and upgrade strategy.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Conflicting runtime setups are detected with actionable output
2) Policy is documented and reflected in setup targets
3) Verification target exits non-zero on critical conflicts
4) Existing workflow remains usable after policy enforcement

title: Add audit trail and change logging for destructive operations
description:
Improve forensics and team confidence around system-level changes.

Scope
- Add timestamped logs for destructive targets.
- Record pre/post state snapshots where feasible.
- Provide summary report command for recent change history.
- Ensure logs do not leak secrets.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Destructive targets emit structured logs
2) Change history can be reviewed after execution
3) Sensitive values are redacted
4) Logging overhead remains acceptable

title: Support non-interactive automation and shared-machine guard rails
description:
Enable safer unattended usage and team/shared-machine operation.

Scope
- Add non-interactive mode with explicit env/config inputs.
- Add shared-machine guard rails that block unsafe targets by default.
- Add role-based policy checks in preflight flow.
- Document secure automation usage patterns.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Non-interactive mode can run end-to-end without prompts
2) Shared-machine mode blocks unsafe operations by default
3) Policy violations produce clear remediation messages
4) Team onboarding docs cover secure automation path

title: Build backup and rollback framework for dotfiles/system changes
description:
Create deterministic rollback capabilities for destructive operations.

Scope
- Snapshot touched files before mutating operations (dotfiles + system targets).
- Add rollback targets for dotfiles deployment and system modifications.
- Store timestamped backups with metadata/manifests for restore integrity.
- Ensure rollback commands are documented and testable.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Every destructive target creates a timestamped backup before mutation
2) Rollback targets restore previous state successfully
3) Backup manifest records what was changed and where
4) Rollback smoke test passes in CI/local full suite

title: Harden destructive system targets with safe defaults
description:
Reduce blast radius of `system-*` and `macos-*` operations.

Scope
- Add strict confirmations for high-risk operations and safe non-interactive defaults.
- Validate sudoers edits safely (e.g., syntax check before apply).
- Make hosts update atomic with timeout/checksum/backup checks.
- Segment risky macOS defaults and ensure each has reversible behavior.
acceptance_criteria:
1) No direct destructive write happens without backup + validation
2) High-risk operations have explicit warning + confirmation path
3) Hosts update is atomic and verifiable
4) Each hardened target documents rollback command

title: Add CI matrix and scheduled clean-room bootstrap verification
description:
Turn deployment assumptions into continuous verification.

Scope
- Expand GitHub Actions to matrix-test supported macOS runners.
- Add scheduled clean-room run to catch ecosystem drift early.
- Enforce preflight/verify gates in CI.
- Capture artifacts/logs for failed bootstrap/deploy steps.
acceptance_criteria:
1) CI uses at least a two-runner macOS matrix
2) Scheduled workflow runs weekly and validates bootstrap/deploy
3) CI fails when verify gate detects conflicts/not_symlinked
4) Failure logs are attached for diagnosis

title: Expand test harness with idempotency, conflict, and rollback scenarios
description:
Increase test realism beyond static checks.

Scope
- Add tests for repeat runs (`apply` twice) to prove idempotency.
- Add conflict simulation tests for pre-existing non-symlink files.
- Add rollback smoke tests for backup/restore flow.
- Tighten shell lint policy and justify any rule suppressions.
acceptance_criteria:
1) New tests fail before implementation and pass afterward
2) Full suite includes idempotency/conflict/rollback scenarios
3) Harness clearly reports precondition skips vs failures
4) CI runs these scenarios on every PR

title: Introduce secrets hardening with SOPS + age
description:
Replace ad-hoc/WIP secret handling with proven encryption workflow.

Scope
- Add SOPS + age setup and key management conventions.
- Define encrypted secret file locations and access patterns.
- Integrate decrypt-at-use behavior into relevant hooks/targets.
- Add migration guide for existing sensitive values.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Sensitive values are encrypted at rest in repo
2) Decryption flow works only with authorized key material
3) No plaintext secrets committed during normal workflow
4) Migration and recovery docs are complete

title: Implement host/role overlays for machine-specific configuration
description:
Add first-class flexibility for work/home/shared machine variants.

Scope
- Introduce machine role detection and explicit override inputs.
- Support selective deploy strategies (targets/profiles) for host variants.
- Add safe conventions for host-specific config deltas.
- Document expected patterns for per-host overrides.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Role/host-specific config can be applied without manual file edits
2) Default behavior remains backward compatible
3) Override mechanism is explicit and testable
4) Docs include examples for work/home/shared machines

title: Add drift detection target and policy gate
description:
Create automated declared-vs-actual drift checks.

Scope
- Implement `gmake drift` using tuckr JSON status + package declaration audits.
- Report unmanaged or divergent state in actionable form.
- Add optional CI gate mode to fail on critical drift classes.
- Document remediation steps per drift type.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Drift command returns machine-readable + human-readable output
2) Critical drift classes produce non-zero exit codes when gate mode enabled
3) Remediation guidance is built into output or docs
4) Command is fast enough for routine use

title: Establish shell startup performance baseline and budget
description:
Prevent shell config regressions from accumulating over time.

Scope
- Add repeatable startup benchmarking target (e.g., zsh startup timings).
- Add optional profiling output (zprof) for hotspot diagnosis.
- Define and document an agreed startup budget threshold.
- Add CI/local check to flag budget regressions.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Baseline startup metrics are captured and documented
2) Budget threshold is explicit and justified
3) Regression detection exists in automated checks
4) Profiling workflow is documented for debugging
